titleStmt.title: Cygnea cantio: or, Learned decisions, and most prudent and pious directions for students in divinitie; delivered by our late soveraigne of happie memorie, King Iames, at White Hall a few weekes before his death.
titleStmt.author: Featley, Daniel, 1582-1645.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Miles Flesher] for Robert Mylbourne at the signe of the Greyhound in Pauls Churchyard,

notesStmt.note: Concerning suppressed and censored portions of "Gods holy mind touching matters morall" by Edward Elton and "Saint Austins religion" by William Crompton.
Half-sheet G² contains the publisher's postscript "The printer to the reader". Variant: lacking this half-sheet.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
